Package me.dessie.dessielib.core.utils.runnables

Class LoopedRunnable

java.lang.Object
org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitRunnable
me.dessie.dessielib.core.utils.runnables.LoopedRunnable
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class LoopedRunnable extends org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitRunnable
BukkitTask timer that will loop for a specified amount of times before automatically stopping.

  • Constructor Details

    • LoopedRunnable

      public LoopedRunnable(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin plugin, int delay, int timer, int loops, Runnable runnable)
      Parameters:
      plugin - Your plugin instance
      delay - The delay in ticks before the Runnable starts
      timer - How long in ticks between each execution
      loops - How many times to run the execution before stopping
      runnable - The Runnable to run

    • LoopedRunnable

      public LoopedRunnable(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin plugin, int delay, int timer, int loops, Consumer<LoopedRunnable> runnable)
      Parameters:
      plugin - Your plugin instance
      delay - The delay in ticks before the Runnable starts
      timer - How long in ticks between each execution
      loops - How many times to run the execution before stopping
      runnable - A Consumer that will run with this provided LoopedRunnable

  • Method Details

    • onComplete

      public LoopedRunnable onComplete(Runnable complete)
      Runs a Runnable when this LoopedRunnable has completed all of it's cycles, and stops.
      Parameters:
      complete - The Runnable to execute when completed.
      Returns:
      This LoopedRunnable

    • getOnComplete

      public Runnable getOnComplete()
      Returns:
      The Runnable that will run when this Task completes.

    • getCurrentLoop

      public int getCurrentLoop()
      Returns what loop the task is currently running.
      Returns:
      The current task loop

    • getDelay

      public int getDelay()
      Returns the initial delay of the task, in ticks.
      Returns:
      The delay before the task starts, in ticks.

    • getLoops

      public int getLoops()
      Returns how many times the task will loop before automatically stopping.
      Returns:
      The amount of loops the task will execute.

    • getTimer

      public int getTimer()
      Returns the amount of time between each loop, in ticks.
      Returns:
      The amount of ticks between each loop

    • getConsumer

      public Consumer<LoopedRunnable> getConsumer()
      Returns a Consumer that will be ran with each run of the Task. The Consumer will be passed the LoopedRunnable as a parameter.
      Returns:
      The Consumer that will run.

      public void run()
